content.description: Crisp edging up a black streak leads to steeper climbing and a crux getting past the last bolt to the anchor.

Easy

rock leads to a fun mantle move onto

steep

rock and the first bolt.

Follow

the slabs path of least resistance to the anchor ledge. Use your own judgment of ability when casting off onto this route. This has solid stone.

It was bolted ground up.
content.location:
Begin downhill and left of

Trango

.

content.description:
Nothing Lasts Forever is a fun toprope just left of

Beginner's Crack

. Do a reach move, and mantel up to the "solid enough" flake. Delicate laybacking leads to easy slab and the anchor. The flake is definitely fragile, hence keeping it just a toprope.
content.location: It is in the center of the wall.

content.description:
Climb the fun black streak with amazing texture to an obvious undercling traverse.

This was bolted ground up.
content.location: This is the rightmost route. The flake is obvious.

content.description: Fun slab climbing leads to a sustained finish.
content.location: Begin behind large pine trees in center of the main slab.

content.description: Squeeze your way up to a fist crack, eventually climbing some rotten rock to the finish. It's possible to traverse the ledge to the bolted anchor and belay from there.
content.location: This ascends the right-facing corner on the left side.

content.description:
Diedri has beautiful slab climbing!

P1. Begin at the lowest point on the left side of the crag. Smear your way up to a high first bolt and up through

steep

slab and a perfect belay ledge.

P2. Smear up the easy slab to a 2 bolt anchor. You might be able to combine both pitches into one

long

classic slab.

Rap the route. It was bolted ground up.
content.protection:
P1. 4 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.

P2. 3 bolts and a ​​​​2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Start as the llowest point on the left side of the crag.

content.description:
This route climbs the water streak via 6 bolts left of

Hooper

, 5.8. Belay below the obvious offwidth. Haul up your wide gear, and battle your way to the top of the cliff, 5.9. This was bolted ground up.

Rap the route.
content.protection:
P1. 6 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.

P2. #2 and #3 Camalots for the start. Double #5 and #6 cams (optional #4) and a 2 bolt anchor.

content.description: This is fun, wide crack climbing.
content.location:
On the far left side of the crag, from the base of

Diedri

, hike cross country to the left. There is a large pine tree that is at the start of the ledge to access the bolted anchor. Traverse out, rap into this corridor, and climb out.
